title: PSG hold off spirited Barcelona to advance
description: Paris St-Germain held off a spirited Barcelona side to reach the quarter-finals of the Champions League with a 5-2 win on aggregate.

title: Liverpool beat Leipzig to seal quarter-final spot
description: Fabinho is "one of the best in the world at number six", says Jurgen Klopp after the Brazilian helps Liverpool beat RB Leipzig to reach the Champions League quarter-finals.

title: Sarah Everard: Human remains found in Kent woodland
description: The 33-year-old disappeared while walking home in Clapham, London, last week.

title: Biden's $1.9tn Covid relief bill passes US Congress
description: The US government has now spent more than $5tn on recovery efforts during the pandemic.

title: Meghan racism row: Society of Editors boss Ian Murray resigns
description: Ian Murray steps down over the group's reaction to Harry and Meghan's comments on media racism.

title: Man City hit Southampton for five to move 14 points clear
description: Manchester City return to winning ways in style with a thumping win over Southampton that moves them 14 points clear at the top of the Premier League table.

title: 'I don't know if it was ever pain-free' - Federer beats Britain's Evans on injury return
description: Roger Federer beats Britain's Dan Evans on his comeback after 14 months out through injury to reach the quarter-finals of the Qatar Open.

title: Will rape allegations change Australia's 'toxic' politics?
description: Australian politics finds itself at a moment of cultural reckoning, writes the BBC's Shaimaa Khalil.

title: Piers Morgan: From Meghan's 'ghosting' to Good Morning Britain exit
description: The presenter left Good Morning Britain this week after a row over Meghan's interview with Oprah.

title: Football gold at Tokyo Olympics 'could reignite women's sport'
description: Winning football gold at the Olympics would help "reignite" interest in women's sport, says Football Association women's football director Sue Campbell.

title: Proposed Champions League reforms 'devastating' for English football
description: Crystal Palace chairman Steve Parish says the proposed Champions League reforms would have "a devastating effect" on English football.

title: England's Six Nations pay split 'an easy decision' - Youngs
description: Scrum-half Ben Youngs says it is an "easy decision" for England's players to share their fees and ensure fringe members are paid the same for the Six Nations.

title: Roblox: How the children's game became a $30bn bet on the Metaverse
description: The gaming company, which has just floated on Wall Street, has plans to inhabit a wider world.

title: Brexit: Why has UK trade with Germany fallen so dramatically?
description: Official statistics show a huge drop in trade during the first month of the new EU-UK relationship.

title: Rayleigh: Bin lorry emptied on street as fire breaks out
description: The blaze is believed to have been caused by discarded batteries, a fire service says.

title: Covid-19: UK hasn't banned export of vaccines, says PM
description: Boris Johnson "corrects" the European Council president over his claims about the government's stance.

title: PMQs: Give MPs a vote on NHS pay, says Sir Keir Starmer
description: Boris Johnson rejects Labour claims nurses and other NHS staff in England are getting a pay cut.

title: Sarah Everard disappearance: House and woods in Kent searched
description: It follows the arrests of a serving Met Police officer and a woman in Kent on Tuesday.

title: Bata blast: Satellite images show Equatorial Guinea destruction
description: Explosions at a munitions depot in the main city Bata led to more than 100 deaths.

title: Meghan and Harry interview: Palace taking race issues 'very seriously'
description: The Palace says "recollections may vary" but matters in the TV interview will be addressed privately.

title: Russia targets Twitter speed over 'banned content'
description: President Putin has criticised social media companies and Twitter is popular with opposition activists.

title: Tesco to start recycling bread bags and crisp packets
description: The supermarket is rolling out new recycling points for soft plastics that often end up in landfill.

title: Lego 'to hire hundreds' more in UK in digital drive
description: The toy giant sees best sales in five years as lockdown spurs growth in Lego sets for families.

title: Covid: Women more anxious and overworked amid pandemic
description: They felt more depressed and lonely, and spent more time on housework and home-schooling children.

title: Ghislaine Maxwell's jail conditions 'torture' - brother
description: The British socialite is currently in a New York prison awaiting trial on sex trafficking charges.

title: 'Test cricket is dead if England rotate in Ashes' - former captain Vaughan
description: Michael Vaughan says "Test cricket is dead" if England rest and rotate players during this winter's Ashes series against Australia.

title: Riise confirmed as Team GB's women's football head coach
description: Interim England manager Hege Riise will take charge of Team GB's women's football squad at this summer's Tokyo Olympics.

title: Covid-19: Too early to book a foreign holiday, Grant Shapps says
description: The transport secretary says there are questions about "how safe it will be in June to travel around".

title: Myanmar coup: 'We were told to shoot protesters', say police who fled
description: Police officers from Myanmar tell the BBC they defected to India after refusing to carry out orders.

title: Wells Bishop's Palace moat drained in error
description: The head gardener opened the sluice gate in anticipation of heavy rain which failed to arrive.

title: Windmill immortalised by Turner returns to glory on Isle of Wight
description: Visitors will be able to clamber to the top of Bembridge Windmill once lockdown restrictions ease.

title: Piers Morgan stands by Meghan criticism after Good Morning Britain exit
description: The Duchess of Sussex also formally complained to ITV about Morgan's remarks, it is being reported.

title: Page to deputise for Wales boss Giggs when World Cup qualifying begins
description: Robert Page is to continue deputising for Wales manager Ryan Giggs as their 2022 World Cup qualifying campaign begins.

title: Fukushima disaster: What happened at the nuclear plant?
description: A tsunami struck the Japanese plant in 2011, leading to the worst nuclear disaster since Chernobyl.

title: Mauricio Pochettino: How is Argentine getting on with PSG's superstars?
description: Mauricio Pochettino must win trophies at PSG - but to do so he will need the club's superstars on board. So how is that dynamic working out?

title: The papers: Royal claims to be handled privately and 'Morgxit'
description: Most of Wednesday's front page lead on the Royal Family's response to Harry and Meghan's interview.

title: Prayuth Chan-ocha: Thai PM sprays sanitiser on reporters
description: Prayuth Chan-ocha was asked about a cabinet reshuffle and chose to deflect the question unusually.

title: Tracy Beaker: Actress Dani Harmer trolled online with 'fat' comments
description: Tracy Beaker actress Dani Harmer says cruel comments have left her anxious about social media.

title: Caroline Flack 'wasn't emotionally wired' for fame
description: A new Channel 4 documentary examines the events leading up to the TV presenter's death in 2020.

title: Trader gets painted stones instead of $36m of copper
description: The company says it took delivery of six thousand tonnes of spray-painted rocks instead of the metal.

title: Why a white poet did not translate Amanda Gorman
description: When a white Dutch author was chosen to translate Gorman's work the decision was swiftly reversed.

title: Abducted, shackled and forced to marry at 12
description: Up to 1,000 Christian, Hindu and Sikh girls are abducted in Pakistan every year, then forced to convert to Islam, and to marry.

title: Ronaldo pain, heroic Porto, standard Haaland - a night that had everything
description: One of Porto's greatest nights, Pirlo in trouble and Haaland can't stop scoring - BBC Sport reflects on the talking points from another dramatic Champions League night.

title: Stolen naked images traded in cities around the world
description: Explicit images of thousands of women are being stolen and traded online.

title: Coronavirus: How airlines stay safe to fly
description: Amid Covid-19, airlines are finding ways to keep their aircraft and staff ready to fly again.

title: Talking to male investors about bras can be 'awkward'
description: The female founder of a lingerie firm explains how she pitches her business to male investors.
